sentence.Network_en: The pictures were sensationalist and could seriously disturb younger readers.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些图片大肆渲染，会让一些比较年轻的读者们惶恐不安。

be careful not to report predictions as certainties — that is sensationalist and does not give the audience any idea of how such models work .注意不要把预测报道成为确定的东西——这是制造轰动效应，而没有给读者任何关于这类模型如何工作的概念。

entry.tran: (新闻报道、电视广播节目)耸人听闻的，追求轰动效应的
entry.def: Sensationalist news reports and television and radio programmes present the facts in a way that makes them seem worse or more shocking than they really are.

example.ex: The pictures were sensationalist and could seriously disturb younger readers.
example.tran: 这些图片大肆渲染，会让一些比较年轻的读者们惶恐不安。

means.word_mean: 1. someone who uses exaggerated or lurid material in order to gain public attention
